field.name: Good Attachment
To make sure baby is attached well:
Touch baby’s lips to nipple
Wait until baby’s mouth open wide
Quickly bring breast from below, aiming nipple up towards the roof of the baby’s mouth
Baby should now take a big mouthful of breast milk
infant_feeding/14.png
The 4 signs of good attachment are:
Baby’s mouth is wide open
Mother can see more of the darker skin (areola) above the baby’s mouth than below
Baby’s lower lop is turned outwards
Baby’s chin is touching breast
infant_feeding/16.png
The signs of effective suckling are:
Baby takes slow, deep suckles, sometimes pausing
You may be able to see or hear your baby swallowing after 1 or 2 suckles
Suckling is comfortable and pain free for you
Your baby finishes the feed, releases the breast and looks contented and relaxed
The breast is softer after the feed
infant_feeding/17.png

After your baby releases one breast offer your baby the other breast. This will make sure that your baby stimulates your milk production in both breasts, and also gets the most nutritious and satisfying milk
